section.title: What are the minimum hardware requirements?
section.p:
400 Mhz CPU + 128 Mb RAM
There is no absolute minimum. Performance is a function of molecule size, window size, and image complexity.
(On MacOS 9 you need more horsepower to make up for poor Java performance.)

section.title: What are the recommended hardware requirements?
section.p: 750 Mhz CPU + 256 Mb RAM -- Of course, more is better.

section.title: Which JVM should I use on Win32 Internet Explorer?
section.p: We strongly recommend that you install the Sun Java Plug-in from www.java.com
Jmol runs fine on the Microsoft JVM that was included with Internet Explorer up until 2002(?). However, since Microsoft no longer supports this product, we strongly recommend that you upgrade.

section.title: Why does it get so much slower when I make the window bigger?
section.p: Twice as many pixels means twice as much work ... and if your applet is twice as wide and twice as high then you have 4 times as many pixels so you get 1/4 the speed.

section.title: Is OpenGL or 3D hardware required to run the JmolApplet?
section.p: No special hardware is required to run the JmolApplet. The graphics engine is a z-buffer implemented in Java, and designed for rendering molecules. (In fact, designed just for Jmol.)

section.title: Performance is great! Why is it so fast?
section.p: It does not use any Java graphics calls. The entire image is built offscreen and sent to the screen with one java.awt.Graphics.drawImage operation.

section.title: Rendering speed is really slow. What can I do?

ul.li: Get a faster machine ... something built this century
Convince Sun to fix graphics performance problems
Review the source code and help speed it up

section.title: Why is the applet slow on Netscape/MacOS 9?
section.p: It is an old Java Virtual Machine that is an interpreter. More modern JVMs compile the java bytecodes.
